unnormalised: Hey everyone! Lately, I've been diving deeper into Yoga, and it's been a game-changer for my overall wellness. Curious about your experiences and favorite practices!
normalised: Hey everyone! Lately, I've been diving deeper into Yoga, and it's been a game-changer for my overall wellness. Curious about your experiences and favorite practices!

unnormalised: For me, starting my day with Surya Namaskar (sun salutations) is non-negotiable. It just wakes up the body and gets the blood flowing, you know? Dr. Sharma at the local Ayurvedic center recommended it, and I've noticed a significant improvement in my energy levels.
normalised: For me, starting my day with Surya Namaskar (sun salutations) is non-negotiable. It just wakes up the body and gets the blood flowing, you know? Doctor Sharma at the local Ayurvedic center recommended it, and I've noticed a significant improvement in my energy levels.

unnormalised: Then, I try to fit in some Pranayama – things like Kapalabhati and Anulom Vilom. I initially found them a bit challenging, but now they're actually quite calming. My friend, Priya, swears by them for reducing stress during her crazy workdays in Bangalore.

unnormalised: I've been experimenting with different Asanas too. Trikonasana (triangle pose) is fantastic for stretching, and Virabhadrasana II (warrior two) makes me feel so grounded. My Yoga studio, covering around 1000 sq ft near Juhu beach, has some amazing instructors.

unnormalised: Anyone else find Yoga helps with their mental clarity? I used to feel so scattered, but now I feel much more focused, especially when tackling complex projects at work. It is amazing how even a 15-minute session can make me feel rejuvenated.

unnormalised: Of course, diet plays a role too. I've been trying to incorporate more sattvic foods into my diet, inspired by my grandmother's recipes and the teachings of Patanjali's Yoga Sutras.
